If you're in the mood for something light-hearted and absurd, I'd recommend giving "Mr. 3000" a try! It stars Evan Jones as an aging baseball star who finds out he didn't quite reach 3,000 hits and decides to come back at age 47 to achieve this goal.

On the other hand, if you're looking for a more intense and reimagined take on Shakespeare's "Macbeth," "Forsaken" might be up your alley. This film features Landon Liboiron as the quarterback king in a small town where football is war, and Demi Moore portrays his complex love interest.

Given that you mentioned a preference for war movies from 2016, I'd highly recommend "Black Hawk Down". This film is an intense and realistic portrayal of one of the most brutal battles in modern military history during the US intervention in Somalia. Notable actors include Ewan McGregor, Josh Hartnett, and Eric Bana.

If you're interested in a different genre within war films, "Hart's War" might be worth checking out as well. It tells the story of a law student turned lieutenant during World War II who must defend a black prisoner of war falsely accused of murder. Bruce Willis and Cole Hauser star in this gripping drama.
